source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_SEQ_00<tab>Yabuqa watches the flames of the fire, a wistful expression upon his face.
target: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_SEQ_00<tab>明けの玉座のヤブカは、内緒の頼み事があるようだ。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_000<tab>Say, friend, might you do me a favor?
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_000……ひょっとして、旅人か？
それなら、ひとつ頼みたいことがある。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_001<tab>Not too far to the southeast of here are the decimated ruins of Kahkol Iloh. I ask that you go there and <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>pray<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for the souls of my deceased parents and sister.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_001南東にある、カコール・イローの廃墟で、
「祈って」きてくれないか？
今は亡き、父と母と、妹のために……。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_002<tab><sigh> It is not a sentiment any of the other Buduga would understand, which is why I need for you to go in my stead.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_002こんなこと、ここの誰にも頼めやしない。
……お願いだ。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_003<tab>Please, make your way to Kahkol Iloh and send your <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>prayers<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to my parents and sister. Mayhap through you, they will receive mine, as well.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_003南東にある、カコール・イローの廃墟で、
「祈って」きてくれないか？
今は亡き……父と母と、妹のために。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_SYSTEM_000_005<tab><var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Pray<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> for Yabuqa's dead family.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_SYSTEM_000_005に、エモート「祈る」をして、
ヤブカの亡き家族へ、祈りを捧げよう。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_010<tab>I appreciate you entertaining such an...odd request. Many of the other Buduga warriors will think me soft for it, but I always feel the need to send someone out to my old village at this time of year to pray for them.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_010すまなかったな。
見ず知らずの亡き家族に、祈りを捧げてくれだなんて、
頼んでしまって……。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_011<tab>Ah─it seems I neglected to tell you that I am originally from Kahkol Iloh. When I was a child, the Buduga came and pillaged our settlement. My family offered me up to them as tribute.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_011俺はもともと、あの居留地に住んでいたカコール族の一員でな。
子どもの頃、ブドゥガ族との戦いに敗れ、
戦利品として連れ去られたんだ。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_012<tab>For the longest time I resented them. I eventually came to learn, however, that shortly after I left, a deadly epidemic swept through my old home and killed everyone who had been left behind.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_012もちろん連れてこられた直後は、俺を手放した家族を恨んださ。
だが、ほどなくしてカコール族は、敗北から立ち直らず壊滅した。
……伝染病に感染していたのさ、戦いが始まる前からな。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_013<tab>I suspect my parents knew what was to come and sent me away to protect me. <sigh> I have years of making up to do for the hatred I harbored in my heart toward them.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_013つまり俺は、奪われたのではなく、病から逃がされたんだよ。
あとで、生き残った者から、俺を手放したことを、
家族が悔やんでいたと聞いて、恨んだ自分が情けなくてな……。

source: TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_014<tab>As a member of the Buduga it is difficult for me to find opportunities to visit Kahkol Iloh and offer them my prayers. That is why I ask travelers passing through to lend me their assistance. You have my sincerest gratitude, friend.
target:
TEXT_STMBDZ602_02780_YABUQA_000_014それからというもの、旅人を見つけては、
俺の代わりに祈ってくれるよう、頼んでるというわけなんだ。
ありがとうよ、旅の方……。
